Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Gallinacin 6 (Gal6, Gal 6, Gal-6, natural AMPs; chicken beta-defensin, UCSS1a; birds, animals; 3S=S)

Literature Information.Literature: The synthetic peptide is tested against Gram- bacteria C. jejuni (MIC 64 ug/ml), S.enterica serovar Typhimurium (MIC >128 ug/ml), E. coli (MIC 64 ug/ml), P.aeruginosa (MIC>128 ug/ml), Gram+ C. perfringens (MIC 8 ug/ml), S. pyogenes (MIC 64 ug/ml), S.aureus (MIC > 128 ug/ml), B.cereus (MIC > 128 ug/ml), fungi C. albicans (MIC 8 ug/ml) and S. cerevisiae (MIC 8 ug/ml). The recombinant form is similarly or less active. Updated 7/2021; 2/2023
Literature Information.Author: van Dijk A, Veldhuizen EJ, Kalkhove SI, Tjeerdsma-van Bokhoven JL, Romijn RA, Haagsman HP.2007
Literature Information.Title: The beta-defensin gallinacin-6 is expressed in the chicken digestive tract and has antimicrobial activity against food-borne pathogens
